name: Go
description: Rich Go language support for Visual Studio Code

commands.title: Go: Current GOPATH
commands.description: See the currently set GOPATH.

commands.title: Go: Locate Configured Go Tools
commands.description: List all the Go tools being used by this extension along with their locations.

commands.title: Go: Test Function At Cursor
commands.description: Runs a unit test at the cursor.

commands.title: Go: Benchmark Function At Cursor
commands.description: Runs a benchmark at the cursor.

commands.title: Go: Debug Test At Cursor
commands.description: Debug test at the cursor.

commands.title: Go: Test File
commands.description: Runs all unit tests in the current file.

commands.title: Go: Test Package
commands.description: Runs all unit tests in the package of the current file.

commands.title: Go: Benchmark Package
commands.description: Runs all benchmarks in the package of the current file.

commands.title: Go: Benchmark File
commands.description: Runs all benchmarks in the current file.

commands.title: Go: Test All Packages In Workspace
commands.description: Runs all unit tests from all packages in the current workspace.

commands.title: Go: Test Previous
commands.description: Re-runs the last executed test.

commands.title: Go: Toggle Test Coverage In Current Package
commands.description: Displays test coverage in the current package.

commands.title: Go: Generate Unit Tests For Package
commands.description: Generates unit tests for the current package

commands.title: Go: Generate Unit Tests For File
commands.description: Generates unit tests for the current file

commands.title: Go: Generate Unit Tests For Function
commands.description: Generates unit tests for the selected function in the current file

commands.title: Go: Generate Interface Stubs
commands.description: Generates method stub for implementing the provided interface and inserts at the cursor.

commands.title: Go: Add Import
commands.description: Add an import declaration

commands.title: Go: Add Package to Workspace
commands.description: Add a package from the imports list to the workspace.

commands.title: Go: Install/Update Tools
commands.description: install/update the required go packages

commands.title: Go: Toggle Test File
commands.description: Toggles between file in current active editor and the corresponding test file.

commands.title: Go: Add Tags To Struct Fields
commands.description: Add tags configured in go.addTags setting to selected struct using gomodifytags

commands.title: Go: Remove Tags From Struct Fields
commands.description: Remove tags configured in go.removeTags setting from selected struct using gomodifytags

commands.title: Go: Fill struct
commands.description: Fill a struct literal with default values

commands.title: Go: Show All Commands...
commands.description: Shows all commands from the Go extension in the quick pick

commands.title: Go: Browse Packages
commands.description: Browse packages and Go files inside the packages.

commands.title: Go: Get Package
commands.description: Run `go get -v` on the package on the current line.

commands.title: Go: Run on Go Playground
commands.description: Upload the current selection or file to the Go Playground

commands.title: Go: Lint Current Package
commands.description: Run linter in the package of the current file.

commands.title: Go: Lint Workspace
commands.description: Run linter in the current workspace.

commands.title: Go: Vet Current Package
commands.description: Run go vet in the package of the current file.

commands.title: Go: Vet Workspace
commands.description: Run go vet in the current workspace.

commands.title: Go: Build Current Package
commands.description: Build the package of the current file.

commands.title: Go: Build Workspace
commands.description: Build the current workspace.

commands.title: Go: Install Current Package
commands.description: Install the current package.

commands.title: Go: Cancel Running Tests
commands.description: Cancels running tests.

commands.title: Go: Apply Cover Profile
commands.description: Applies existing cover profile.

commands.title: Go: Extract to function
commands.description: Extract to function using godoctor.

commands.title: Go: Extract to variable
commands.description: Extract to variable using godoctor.

commands.title: Go: Restart Language Server
commands.description: Restart the running instance of the language server

go.buildOnSave.description: Compiles code on file save using 'go build -i' or 'go test -c -i'. Options are 'workspace', 'package', or 'off'.

go.buildFlags.description: Flags to `go build`/`go test` used during build-on-save or running tests. (e.g. ["-ldflags='-s'"])

go.buildTags.description: The Go build tags to use for all commands, that support a `-tags '...'` argument. When running tests, go.testTags will be used instead if it was set.

go.testTags.description: The Go build tags to use for when running tests. If null, then buildTags will be used.

go.installDependenciesWhenBuilding.description: If true, then `-i` flag will be passed to `go build` everytime the code is compiled.

go.lintOnSave.description: Lints code on file save using the configured Lint tool. Options are 'file', 'package', 'workspace' or 'off'.

go.lintFlags.description: Flags to pass to Lint tool (e.g. ["-min_confidence=.8"])

go.vetOnSave.description: Vets code on file save using 'go tool vet'. Options are 'workspace', 'package or 'off'.

go.vetFlags.description: Flags to pass to `go tool vet` (e.g. ["-all", "-shadow"])

go.formatTool.description: Pick 'gofmt', 'goimports', 'goreturns' or 'goformat' to run on format. Not applicable when using the language server. Choosing 'goimports' or 'goreturns' will add missing imports and remove unused imports.

go.formatFlags.description: Flags to pass to format tool (e.g. ["-s"])

go.inferGopath.description: Infer GOPATH from the workspace root.

go.gopath.description: Specify GOPATH here to override the one that is set as environment variable. The inferred GOPATH from workspace root overrides this, if go.inferGopath is set to true.

go.toolsGopath.description: Location to install the Go tools that the extension depends on if you don't want them in your GOPATH.

go.goroot.description: Specifies the GOROOT to use when no environment variable is set.

go.testOnSave.description: Run 'go test' on save for current package. It is not advised to set this to `true` when you have Auto Save enabled.

go.coverOnSave.description: If true, runs 'go test -coverprofile' on save and shows test coverage.

go.coverOnTestPackage.description: If true, shows test coverage when Go: Test Package command is run.

go.coverOnSingleTest.description: If true, shows test coverage when Go: Test Function at cursor command is run.

go.coverOnSingleTestFile.description: If true, shows test coverage when Go: Test Single File command is run.

go.coverageOptions.description: Use these options to control whether only covered or only uncovered code or both should be highlighted after running test coverage

coveredHighlightColor.description: Color in the rgba format to use to highlight covered code.

uncoveredHighlightColor.description: Color in the rgba format to use to highlight uncovered code.

coveredGutterStyle.description: Gutter style to indicate covered code.

uncoveredGutterStyle.description: Gutter style to indicate covered code.

go.coverageDecorator.description: This option lets you choose the way to display code coverage. Choose either to highlight the complete line or to show a decorator in the gutter. You can customize the color for the former and the style for the latter.

go.testTimeout.description: Specifies the timeout for go test in ParseDuration format.

go.testEnvVars.description: Environment variables that will passed to the process that runs the Go tests

go.testEnvFile.description: Absolute path to a file containing environment variables definitions. File contents should be of the form key=value.

go.testFlags.description: Flags to pass to `go test`. If null, then buildFlags will be used.

go.generateTestsFlags.description: Additional command line flags to pass to `gotests` for generating tests.

go.toolsEnvVars.description: Environment variables that will passed to the processes that run the Go tools (e.g. CGO_CFLAGS)

go.gocodeFlags.description: Additional flags to pass to gocode. Not applicable when using the language server.

go.gocodeAutoBuild.description: Enable gocode's autobuild feature. Not applicable when using the language server.

go.gocodePackageLookupMode.description: Used to determine the Go package lookup rules for completions by gocode. Only applies when using nsf/gocode. Latest versions of the Go extension uses mdempsky/gocode by default. Not applicable when using the language server.

go.useCodeSnippetsOnFunctionSuggest.description: Complete functions with their parameter signature, including the variable types

go.useCodeSnippetsOnFunctionSuggestWitho.description: Complete functions with their parameter signature, excluding the variable types

go.autocompleteUnimportedPackages.description: Include unimported packages in auto-complete suggestions.

go.docsTool.description: Pick 'godoc' or 'gogetdoc' to get documentation. Not applicable when using the language server.

go.useLanguageServer.description: Use the Go language server "gopls" from Google for powering language features like code navigation, completion, formatting & diagnostics.

go.languageServerFlags.description: Flags like -rpc.trace and -logfile to be used while running the language server.

diagnostics.description: If true, the language server will provide build, vet errors and the extension will ignore the `buildOnSave`, `vetOnSave` settings.

documentLink.description: If true, the language server will provide clickable Godoc links for import statements.

go.languageServerExperimentalFeatures.description: Use this setting to enable/disable experimental features from the language server.

go.useGoProxyToCheckForToolUpdates.description: When enabled, the extension automatically checks the Go proxy if there are updates available for the Go tools (at present, only gopls) it depends on and prompts the user accordingly

go.gotoSymbol.includeImports.description: If false, the import statements will be excluded while using the Go to Symbol in File feature

go.gotoSymbol.includeGoroot.description: If false, the standard library located at $GOROOT will be excluded while using the Go to Symbol in File feature

references.description: If true, enables the references code lens. Uses guru. Recalculates when there is change to the document followed by scrolling.

runtest.description: If true, enables code lens for running and debugging tests

go.enableCodeLens.description: Feature level setting to enable/disable code lens for references and run/debug tests

promptForTags.description: If true, Go: Add Tags command will prompt the user to provide tags and options instead of using the configured values

tags.description: Comma separated tags to be used by Go: Add Tags command

options.description: Comma separated tag=options pairs to be used by Go: Add Tags command

transform.description: Transformation rule used by Go: Add Tags command to add tags

go.addTags.description: Tags and options configured here will be used by the Add Tags command to add tags to struct fields. If promptForTags is true, then user will be prompted for tags and options. By default, json tags are added.

enabled.description: If true, runs gotype on the file currently being edited and reports any semantic or syntactic errors found.

delay.description: The number of milliseconds to delay before execution. Resets with each keystroke.

go.liveErrors.description: Use gotype on the file currently being edited and report any semantic or syntactic errors found after configured delay.

promptForTags.description: If true, Go: Remove Tags command will prompt the user to provide tags and options instead of using the configured values

tags.description: Comma separated tags to be used by Go: Remove Tags command

options.description: Comma separated tag=options pairs to be used by Go: Remove Tags command

go.removeTags.description: Tags and options configured here will be used by the Remove Tags command to remove tags to struct fields. If promptForTags is true, then user will be prompted for tags and options. By default, all tags and options will be removed.

openbrowser.description: Whether to open the created Go Playground in the default browser

share.description: Whether to make the created Go Playground shareable

run.description: Whether to run the created Go Playground after creation

properties.description: The flags configured here will be passed through to command `goplay`

toggleTestFile.description: If true, adds command to toggle between a Go file and its test file to the editor context menu

addTags.description: If true, adds command to add configured tags from struct fields to the editor context menu

removeTags.description: If true, adds command to remove configured tags from struct fields to the editor context menu

fillStruct.description: If true, adds command to fill struct literal with default values to the editor context menu

testAtCursor.description: If true, adds command to run the test under the cursor to the editor context menu

testFile.description: If true, adds command to run all tests in the current file to the editor context menu

testPackage.description: If true, adds command to run all tests in the current package to the editor context menu

generateTestForFunction.description: If true, adds command to generate unit tests for function under the cursor to the editor context menu

generateTestForFile.description: If true, adds command to generate unit tests for current file to the editor context menu

generateTestForPackage.description: If true, adds command to generate unit tests for currnt package to the editor context menu

addImport.description: If true, adds command to import a package to the editor context menu

testCoverage.description: If true, adds command to run test coverage to the editor context menu

playground.description: If true, adds command to upload the current file or selection to the Go Playground

debugTestAtCursor.description: If true, adds command to debug the test under the cursor to the editor context menu

go.editorContextMenuCommands.description: Experimental Feature: Enable/Disable entries from the context menu in the editor.

go.gotoSymbol.ignoreFolders.description: Folder names (not paths) to ignore while using Go to Symbol in Workspace feature

followPointers.description: FollowPointers requests pointers to be automatically dereferenced

maxVariableRecurse.description: MaxVariableRecurse is how far to recurse when evaluating nested types

maxStringLen.description: MaxStringLen is the maximum number of bytes read from a string

maxArrayValues.description: MaxArrayValues is the maximum number of elements read from an array, a slice or a map

maxStructFields.description: MaxStructFields is the maximum number of fields read from a struct, -1 will read all fields

dlvLoadConfig.description: LoadConfig describes to delve, how to load values from target's memory

apiVersion.description: Delve Api Version to use. Default value is 2.

showGlobalVariables.description: Boolean value to indicate whether global package variables should be shown in the variables pane or not.

go.delveConfig.description: Delve settings that applies to all debugging sessions. Debug configuration in the launch.json file will override these values.

go.alternateTools.description: Alternate tools or alternate paths for the same tools used by the Go extension. Provide either absolute path or the name of the binary in GOPATH/bin, GOROOT/bin or PATH. Useful when you want to use wrapper script for the Go tools or versioned tools from https://gopkg.in.

go.description: Alternate tool to use instead of the go binary or alternate path to use for the go binary.

gocode.description: Alternate tool to use instead of the gocode binary or alternate path to use for the gocode binary.

gopkgs.description: Alternate tool to use instead of the gopkgs binary or alternate path to use for the gopkgs binary.

gopls.description: Alternate tool to use instead of the gopls binary or alternate path to use for the gopls binary.

go-outline.description: Alternate tool to use instead of the go-outline binary or alternate path to use for the go-outline binary.

guru.description: Alternate tool to use instead of the guru binary or alternate path to use for the guru binary.
